title: Richard Pilger
deleted: Barr's authorization went against a decades-old policy at the Department of Justice to keep law enforcement separate from actions that could affect an election's outcome, which prompted Pilger's resignation letter which described "an important new policy abrogating the forty-year-old Non-Interference Policy for ballot fraud investigations in the period prior to elections becoming certified and uncontested."
He continued, "Having familiarized myself with the new policy and its ramifications... I must regretfully resign from my role as Director of the Election Crimes Branch."<ref name=":0" />
He will continue at the Department of Justice as a line prosecutor in the Public Integrity section prosecuting corruption cases.<ref name=":0" />
